title: Fierce Axolotl
details: (they/them) is a fiercely kind content creator from Mexico, currently living in the US with their spouse and two tabby cats. They showcase a wide variety of indie games on their Twitch channel while creating a caring and supportive community. Fierce also donates all the money they make through their content to Mexican charities and mutual funds.

title: Hippolyte Caubet
details: (he/him) is a game designer and programmer at Nerial | Devolver Digital, a teacher in psychology of games and game design in France and an involved individual in building a brighter, more inclusive and more respectful future for the industry. Along with the non-profit organization he's part of, Game Impact, he works on a daily basis in various local actions in schools or online to raise awareness on the many social impacts of games.

title: Luján Oulton
details: is a games curator, cultural producer and lecturer with a Master Degree in Communication and Cultural Creation by Walter Benjamin Foundation. Currently Luján is Artistic Director of Now Play This Festival (London), producer of GAIA and co-editor of Cuadernos de Game Studies at Universidad de Palermo. Among diverse exhibitions and new media art projects she created and produced Game on! El arte en juego an artgames and playful media exhibit that ran in Argentina for over a decade. In 2019 she co-founded GAIA (Game Arts International Assembly) with Jim Munroe (Canada) Lujan is also member of the GameStudies group at IIEAC (Instituto de Investigación y Experimentación en Arte y Crítica) and cofounder of Women in Games Argentina.

title: Jim Munroe
details: 's graphic novels and prose novels have gotten him dubbed a “pop culture provocateur” by the Austin Chronicle. His lo-fi sci-fi feature films were praised by Wired and the Guardian, and his political videogames have appeared at Sundance and Cannes. He co-founded the world’s first videogame arts organization and now co-organizes Toronto Games Week. He was an Art Gallery of Ontario Artist-in-Residence in 2014 and he lives in the Junction neighbourhood in Toronto.

title: Marie LeBlanc Flanagan
details: is an artist working in the playful spaces between people, especially related to connection and community. Marie builds experimental video games, playful installations, and cooperative experiences. Marie has an enduring fondness for the infinite possibilities of trash. Marie founded Wyrd Arts Initiatives (a nationwide nonprofit dedicated to encouraging, documenting, and connecting creative expression across Canada), A Kind of Play (workshops on making experimental games), Drone Day (an annual international celebration of drone music communities) and co-founded Imaginary Residency (an artist-run online residency).

title: Lan Roed
details: is a creative and practical game designer with a decade of experience in the gaming industry, during which she has contributed to successful projects and released her own indie game Cribbage With Grandpas. This game received regular features on the Apple App Store and earned a nomination at IndieCade in 2017. In addition to my professional work Lan has designed and taught courses in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and Typography at Vancouver Film School. She is deeply passionate about experimental and non-traditional games; Has founded the 500+ member Alt Games Vancouver meetup group and Heart Projector — a group she co-founded with a few other local developers in town which has been curating exhibitions of experimental experiences for over six years.

title: Samuel Baidoo
details: Samuel Baidoo received their Masters in the Arts with a focus on Illustration and Graphic Design from Sint-Lucas in 2015 and graduated as dancer from the Dance department at the Royal Conservatory of Antwerp in 2018. They take on different roles in the field. As performer, co-creating and touring works for young audiences and adults in Belgium and abroad for makers and companies such as: Koen de Preter, Maud Le Pladec, Lola Bogaert, Agostina D'Alessandro, Nat Gras, Tuur Marinus, Michiel Vandevelde & Nikima Jagudajev.As mentor & coach they guided the process of Rino Sokol & Hernan Mancebo Martinez for Physical Proof at Theater Aan Zee in 2020. Since 3 years they mentor the choreographic work of the Bachelor 3 students at the Royal Conservatory of Antwerp. In season 24-25 they will be coaching VOUW a new creation by Annelies Van Hullebusch. As part of the Hanafubuki collective they see their love for movement & the visual merging while enjoying the collaborative work. In recent years the creations of Hanafubuki have been seen all over Flanders and abroad. As individual maker they created wijtwee//nosotros for Nat Gras in collaboration with Hernan Mancebo Martinez and grot-nest-tempel-huis for Leuven-Hasselt based company tout petit that premièred in february 2024. They presented two iterations of Huis voor Tranenat STORMOPKOMST festival in De Warande in 2022 & 2023. Currently Samuel continues to work on Plum Road Tea Dream, a research into the possibility of the videogame or the virtual as a sanctuary.

title: Mer Grazzini
details: Mer Grazzini is a game designer and 2D artist from Argentina. Before getting into the dev scene in 2014, she did music videos, CD and book covers, wrote comics, among other things. She was co-founder of Matajuegos, the first Argentine gamedev workers cooperative. She also works as a teacher and journalist, focusing on small expressive indie devs and Latin American creators. She loves to go solo dev as well as working with teams, and she cares about games with a social impact and using game design as a means of expressing personal and local interests.

title: Heather Kelley
details: Heather Kelley is an award-winning game designer, media artist, curator and researcher. Her experimental game work focuses on unique sensory effects, integrating perceptions of touch, smell, movement, sound, and nervous system response. Since 2015 she has taught at the Entertainment Technology Center of Carnegie Mellon University, where she holds the title Associate Teaching Professor. She serves as the Sensory Director at the LIKELIKE gallery for independent games and playful arts. Ms. Kelley was named by Fast Company magazine as one of 2011’s thirty most influential women in technology, the same year that her innovative mobile app OhMiBod Remote won Best Application from Vienna Austria’s annual Content Awards. In 2012, she co-curated Joue le jeu, a groundbreaking 5000 m2 exhibition of video games and commissioned play installations in Paris, France. In 2013, Microsoft Women In Gaming awarded her their Innovator Award. Ms. Kelley is a founder of the experimental game collective Kokoromi, with whom she produced and curated the renowned GAMMA events from 2006 to 2010, promoting experimental games as creative expression in a social context. In 2016 Kokoromi released the retrofuturistic VR puzzle game SUPERHYPERCUBE on the Sony Playstation 4. Ms. Kelley’s extensive career in game development has included design and production of touchscreen vibrator controllers, AAA next-gen console games, interactive smart toys, mobile and handheld games, research games, installation games, and web communities for girls. She holds a Master of Arts in Communication from the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Shalev Moran
details: is a designer and artist based in Copenhagen. He currently works as a game designer and director at Bird Island, and co-runs the political-sci-fi project Speculative Tourism.Previously he was the games curator at Print Screen Festival, a lecturer at Shenkar College’s Game Center, and a game designer at various companies. He received his B.A. from TAU's Honors Program in the Humanities and Arts, and his M.A. in Game Design from The Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts.

title: Susie Buchan
details: is a creative producer and performance artist based in Dundee, Scotland who works across experimental games and contemporary art. She's a director of the creative studio and community Biome Collective, co-producer and co-curator of Arcadia Festival and the producer for an unannounced indie game studio on their debut game. She's passionate about creating bold and authentic work, cross-disciplinary collaborations, fostering supportive communities and exploring creativity in unique and thought-provoking ways.

title: Mario Barranco
details: Graduated in Social and Cultural Anthropology from the University of Seville, with a Master's in Contemporary Film and Audiovisual Studies and a Ph.D. in Communication from Pompeu Fabra University. Member of the CINEMA Research Group in the Department of Communication at UPF. He has participated in funded projects on Spanish cinema (CINEMA group 2020-2022) and experimental ethnography (ETSICO group 2018-2021). He has also coordinated and edited international academic journals on video games and cinema such as Lifeplay and Comparative Cinema. Currently, he combines his teaching duties with his work as a digital artist and game designer in experimental video game projects, participating with his project Maya in development incubators such as Gameplay and Arsenal (Pompeu Fabra University).His areas of interest include, among others, the avant-garde in video games and their relationship with experimental cinema, the gamification of aesthetics, artificial intelligence, digital humanities, and cyber microcultures

title: Ágnes Karolina Bakk
details: Ph.D. is the head and lead researcher of Immersion and Interaction Hub at the Innovation Center of Moholy-Nagy University of Art and Design. She is also a narrative designer focusing on immersive theatrical formats, immersive storytelling & the science of magic. She currently leads research projects on romantic relationships in Metaverse-like environments and on psychological restoration in a nature-simulation VR and its clinical use. She is the founder of the Zip-Scene conference that is running since 2018, and cofounder of Random Error Studio which focuses on creation of VR productions. She is also the co-curator of Vektor VR section, Hungary’s first VR-focused event. She teaches immersive storytelling, and speculative design and offers talks at various conferences from Kobe (JP) to Montreal (CA) including festivals (Stereopsia, DokLeipzig). She is also a narrative designer for several video games

title: Sol Sanchez
details: CCO at Somber Pixel and President of FemDevs Peru. Sol started working on games as a Programmer and is now co-leader of an indie studio in Peru. In addition to video game development, Sol is very passionate about supporting the Peruvian industry. Her work in the industry has led her to receive recognitions such as 'GIBiz Game Changer' and 'The Game Awards Future Class.

title: Angelo Careri
details: is the chief editor of Immersion magazine and a researcher in the digital lab of École des Beaux Arts de Lyon (Unité de Recherche Numérique). His artistic practice mainly involves writing and performing, with a focus on political themes and utopias. He currently teaches video game theory at Ecole de Communication Visuelle and ITECOM Art & Design (Paris).

title: Cat Bluemke & Jonathan Carroll
details: specialize in game design, expanded reality, and performance. Working together as SpekWork Studio they’ve created games, performances, and immersive experiences that explore technology’s ability to obscure the line between work and play. They’ve exhibited internationally with prominent institutions including Rhizome and the New Museum (2020) and the Venice Architecture Biennale (2018) as part of the American Pavillion’s corollary exhibits, and featured recently with the Fotomuseum Winterthur (2024), the Milan Machinima Festival (2024), the Singapore Art Museum (2023), Art Gallery of Regina (2023), and the Art Gallery of Grande Prairie (2022).Since 2019, they’ve spearheaded digital programs at the MacKenzie Art Gallery (Regina, Saskatchewan, Treaty 4 Territory, Canada), overseeing digital exhibitions and residency programs. They are currently developing the Gallery’s Digital Exhibition Toolkit and Art Installation Launcher (DETAIL) for public release in late 2024.

title: Cat Bluemke
details: specialize in game design, expanded reality, and performance. Working as SpekWork Studio they’ve created games, performances, and immersive experiences that explore technology’s ability to obscure the line between work and play. They’ve exhibited internationally with prominent institutions including Rhizome and the New Museum (2020) and the Venice Architecture Biennale (2018) as part of the American Pavillion’s corollary exhibits, and featured recently with the Fotomuseum Winterthur (2024), the Milan Machinima Festival (2024), the Singapore Art Museum (2023), Art Gallery of Regina (2023), and the Art Gallery of Grande Prairie (2022).Since 2019, they’ve spearheaded digital programs at the MacKenzie Art Gallery (Regina, Saskatchewan, Treaty 4 Territory, Canada), overseeing digital exhibitions and residency programs. They are currently developing the Gallery’s Digital Exhibition Toolkit and Art Installation Launcher (DETAIL) for public release in late 2024.

title: Chaz Evans
details: is Assistant Professor of Media Art at the University of South Carolina as well as Co-Founder of VGA Gallery. Evans is an artist, educator, writer, and curator. His work deals with the connections between video game art, 3D animation, software production, and the art historical past as well as the tensions between global technological powers and local media cultures.

title: David Antognoli
details: (he/him) is the Director at Night City, a Chicago studio focused on community-based game development, exhibitions, and educational resources. In addition, he is an Assistant Professor of Game Design in Columbia College Chicago where his creative and scholarly agenda emphasizes game experiences in community contexts. A game industry veteran with experience in both programming and design roles, David has worked on projects with companies like Microsoft, Sega, 2K Games, and Nickelodeon. Now he finds creative refuge in independent game development and helping others build, share, and experience amazing games.

title: Dominique Gawlowski
details: is the managing director at Free Lives by day, festival director for Playtopia by night. She has been in events for more than 15 years before moving to the games industry so when Free Lives wanted to start Playtopia, it was a major bonus they knew someone who could do it. Dominique and 3 friends whom she has done events together with in the past also work in games now (some at Free Lives) and so they have all come together to work on Playtopia as their passion for games and events are now combined! and the team as grown by A LOT!

title: Emily Koonce
details: (she/her) is a multi-media artist, writer, and community organizer interested in the intersection of folk games, philosophy, and education. She has worked as an adjunct professor at the NYU Game Center, as the program director of the National Student Leadership Conference's game design high school program, and as a Meow at Babycastles in NYC. She is currently based in Chicago where she can be found turning movies into drinking games and giving riddles to strangers at parties. Her videogame crockpot about being bored in the suburbs released earlier this year.

title: Gonzalo Borzino
details: is a professional Game Designer, a game jam enthusiast, a university teacher of video game production and part of the Red de Comunidades de Desarrollo de Videojuegos. Gonzalo co-founded AcciónDev, a community that promotes development around themes of social, ecological, reflexive and identity interest, from Latin American vision. Acciondev has participated in the creation of various gamejams, learning spaces and gaming articles.

title: Merlina Rañi
details: (Brazil, 1987) is an art curator specializing in digital media and scientific dissemination. Her research delves into virtual environments and their connection with physicality, aimed at developing a critical perspective on language transformations: new information circuits, misinformation formats, and the rhetoric of digital media. Through her writing practice, she explores formats between journalism and fiction in search of experience-oriented and multi-perspective narratives. Her latest works focus on the implications of technological abstraction on society's political and affective dimensions.

title: Hexe Fey
details: is an interdisciplinary games maker, curator, dancer, nerd, transsexual. Oglala Lakota and European.

title: Jamin Warren
details: founded Gameplayarts, an organization dedicated to the research and practice of game-based arts and culture. He has produced events such as the Versions conference for VR arts and creativity, in partnership with NEW INC. Warren also programmed the first Tribeca Games Festival, the groundbreaking Arcade at the Museum of Modern Art, and the Kill Screen Festival, which Mashable called 'the TED of videogames.' Additionally, he has served as an advisor for the Museum of Modern Art's design department, acted as cluster chair for the Gaming category for the Webbys, and hosted Game/Show for PBS Digital Studios.

title: Pablo F. Quarta
details: is a narrative designer and game producer who specializes in the development of videogames with strong social, political, and cultural perspectives that draw from Latin American culture and identity. They are part of the development team of the award-winning surrealist documentary game Atuel, and were one of the co-founders of Matajuegos, Argentina’s very first indie game workers’ co-op. Pablo has given talks on their work at international events such as the GDC, IndieCade, and DIGRA. They also teach game and narrative design at the National University Scalabrini Ortiz and the University Torcuato Di Tella in Buenos Aires.

title: Sithe Ncube
details: is Co-Founder and Director of Ubongo Game Lab, an organization that seeks to encourage the growth of the game development community within Zambia. She works to increase the participation of African women in game development within the continent and on the global stage by serving as the Sub-Saharan Africa Regional Organizer for Global Game Jam, the world's largest game development event.

title: Kjell Håftén
details: is a producer of independent games culture working with the local games scene in Gothenburg, Sweden. His work consists of building creative infrastructure around indie games through events, collaborations and building platforms for creation and exhibition of games and playful art. He also works as a freelance games educator, teaching kids how to make experimental games and spreading games literacy through talks and workshops.

title: Ophélie Apie Oddy
details: Paris native, blending her vibrant Parisian upbringing with Abidjan roots, Ophélie is a powerhouse in video games and comics. Armed with a Graduate degree in Economics and Management and a passion for human resources, she has created a cross-cultural educational blend. She worked as a Content Manager and Community Builder at GARA, a mobile games and comics distributor, Ophélie where she only brought entertainment but also ensured accessibility through mobile wallets. Beyond GARA, she collaborates with the Goethe-Institut, organizing events like the Goethe Gboro Night, displaying her commitment to educating African youth about gaming industry opportunities. Additionally, she serves as the African representative of the French association Afrogameuses, contributing to the advocacy for women in the gaming industry, and manages the African Gaming Talents project. A self-proclaimed multipotentialist with love for music, gaming, and an insatiable curiosity, Ophélie identifies as an African Gaming Promoter. Passionate about women's representation, she dreams of establishing the first women's-only gaming studio in Africa. Ophélie's journey is a personal dedication to diversity, creativity, and empowerment in the gaming world.

title: Laura Gonzalez
details: is the Co-founder  of IndieDevDay and the Director of PowerUp+ a pre incubator with gender perspective.She is a Full Stack Programmer but helping the Indie Video game industry in spain become her full time Job. She is part of FEMDEVS, and loves to collaborate with initiatives like Girls Make Games or WomenGameJam International to improve the access of women and minorities in the videogame industry.

title: Louis Brooks
details: (he/him) keeps himself busy doing design work, making websites, writing music and modelling 3D spaces. Most recently, he released his first video game - a digital museum about exclusionary architecture.

title: Nico Valdivia Hennig
details: is a Chilean game designer, psychologist, and cultural studies researcher with a decade of experience in game design. Currently, as a PhD student in Hispanic Studies at the University of California, Riverside, their focus is on ludic activism, game design, and production in the Global South, particularly in Latin America. Nico co-founded Niebla Games, launching games for PC and mobile platforms, and will soon be an artist-in-residence of the Speculative Play and Just Futurities program at Indiana University. At the University of California, Riverside, they have been organizing events around 'Impactful Games & Ludic Activism,' showcasing games like 'Liyla & the Shadows of War' with Rasheed Abueideh, and 'Atuel' with Pablo Quarta from Matajuegos. The upcoming event will focus on ludic activism from Ukraine. Additionally, Nico was recently nominated with their team for the AMaze/Berlin Festival of Experimental Game Art 2024.

title: Bethlehem Anteneh
details: is an Ethiopian game-thinking expert and ecosystem builder with a background in architectural design, known for her innovative use of games to design environments and frameworks that enhance human experience and problem-solving. As the founder and co-founder of several initiatives, including PlayLab, Digital Learning Hub, and Games For Change Africa, she has been instrumental in advancing the games industry across Africa and Europe. Her work spans over 25 countries, where she has managed projects, curated communities, and led workshops and hackathons. Notably, she was the Game-Thinking Lead for the 'EnterAfrica-Gamify Your City Future!' project with the Goethe-Institut and currently curates Addis Abeba's annual gaming festival, ChewataCon. Bethlehem is also a thought leader in learning experience design, a founding member of the Ethiopian Games Association, and actively involved in global gaming and impact networks.

title: Peter Devisch
details: is working as a music programmer and festival coordinator at the cultural centre of Bruges. It’s an organization that programs stage arts and plastic arts in several theatres in the city. Every two years they are changing their main old city theatre in a huge arcade hall during the Playtime festival. They present games for a young public who have a link with arts and/or society. The purpose is to introduce playful arts as a full-fledged art genre at the public. In the future, they will look for further international collaborations. The next festival Playtime 20.25 will take place from 7-10 March.

title: Seb Galvez
details: is an independent, multi-media artist with a focus on interactive art and narrative. Their current work focuses on experimenting with short-form games, as well as community organizing as part of Chicago nonprofit Indie City Games.

title: Tobias Kopka
details: is an experienced program director and connector in the games industry. Since 2009, he's directed events like Ludicious Zürich Game Festival, Next Level, devcom, Gamescom Congress, and Reboot Develop. Beyond event curation, Tobias co-creates VR&Dance pieces with the VR Dance Club and offers support as a Systemic Coach. He co-founded the European Game Showcase and the #ArtOfCoding campaign, pivotal in having the Demoscene recognized by UNESCO as the first digital culture to be considered intangible heritage.

title: Isabelle Arvers
details: ,PHD, is a French artist and curator whose research focuses on the interaction between art and video games. For the past twenty years, she has been investigating the artistic, ethical, and critical implications of digital gaming. Her work explores the creative potential of hacking video games through machinima. As a curator, she focuses on video games as a new language for artists. She curated several shows and festivals around the world, including Jibambe na Tec (Nairobi, AF, 2020), Tecnofeminismo (Bogota, AF, 2019), Art Games World Tour exhibit (Buenos Aires, 2019), Interspecies Imaginaries (Overkill, 2019), Machinima in Mash Up (Vancouver Art Gallery, 2016), UCLA Gamelab Festival (Hammer Museum, Los Angeles 2015, 2017), Evolution of Gaming (Vancouver, 2014), Game Heroes (Alcazar, Marseille, 2011), Playing Real (Gamerz, 2007), Mind Control (Banana RAM Ancona, Italy, 2004), Node Runner (Paris, 2004) Playtime (Villette Numérique, 2002). In 2019, she embarked on an Art and Games World Tour in non western countries to promote the notion of diversity of gender, sexuality and geographic origin, focusing on queer, feminist, and decolonial practices. In 2024, Arvers completed her PHD on Art & Games decolonization.

title: Allison JingYang
details: is a producer and storyteller currently based in Hong Kong. You can usually find her designing a game or game experience, curating a game-related exhibition, writing research and media pieces on game and gaming (particularly in the sinophone context), teaching game courses in universities.

title: Artūras Rumiancevas
details: Artūras is a Media professional with a passion to understand and promote video game culture. Several years of experience covering online and offline media as well as organizing events of various scales, including the largest video games culture convent - GameOn Vilnius.

title: Jo Summers
projects: Now Play This, Global Game Jam, Profanity Itd
details: Jo specializes in digital production and technology events. Jo has eight years experience of running a wide range of community and technology-focused events, from concept to completion.

title: Jonathan Kinkley
details: Jonathan is an arts writer and museum professional with a scholarly focus on video games and new media art. He is currently owner and curator, Chicago Gamespace; director of arts advancement at University of Illinois at Chicago; and Co-Founder, Executive Director (2013 - 2020) and Board Member, VGA Gallery.

title: Jooyoung Oh
details: Jooyoung is a media artist who uses interactive technologies such as games and artificial intelligence chatbots. she has developed her work under two interdisciplinary backgrounds: visual design and engineering.

title: Len Predko
details: Len is a practicing artist with a Bachelor of Design from OCAD University. He is the current Executive Director of Hand Eye Society and works as a Community Manager at Kitten Cup Studio.

title: Lynn Hughes
details: Lynn has a background in English, Art and the History and Philosophy of Science and Technology. She was a painter for many years but began, around 2000, to slowly move into interactive production, and then games. In 2008 she founded the Technoculture Art and Games (TAG) research centre at Concordia University (Montreal) with Bart Simon.

title: Marie Janin
details: (she/her) is the co-director of The Overkill together with Aike Lütkemöller, a gaming, art and film festival and co- director of Sickhouse, a playful art space in Enschede. As a curator she focuses on digital culture and its impact on our society.

title: Simon Bachelier
details: is an independent curator exploring the variety of practices in digital games. One of his main focus in his exhibition work has been to experiment about the spaces between the players and the watchers (among visitors). He has also been experimenting around the link between Theater, Perfomance Arts and Digital Games since 2016 with a format he called Playformance. He has cofounded the French collective Sous les néons in 2021 gathering people from Theater and Indie Games, where they explore the connection between stage play and performing games in front of a live (and on-site) audience.

title: Zuraida Buter
details: (she/her) is an award-winning curator of playful culture and arts based in the Netherlands. She specializes in curating, initiating, and documenting events centered on playful culture and games, fostering international collaboration and creative experiences. She is the founder of the playful culture organization zo-ii and co-founder of the Playful Arts Festival, which highlights the intersection of art, play, technology, and design. Zuraida has curated talks and exhibitions at festivals and events worldwide, including IndieCade Europe, A MAZE. / Berlin, and Screenshake. She is also a strong advocate for diversity in the gaming industry through her work with Women in Games NL (WiGNL). Previously, she initiated the Dutch indie game showcase INDIGO and served as Executive Director of the Global Game Jam (2010-2014). She has also lectured on game design theory at the Utrecht School of Arts (HKU) and received accolades such as the IndieCade Game Changer Award (2020) and the EA Award for Achievement and Innovation (2013).

title: Lorenzo Pilia
details: is a curator, host and event producer. He's primarily known as the founder and main organiser of Talk & Play, <an event about games for everyone> taking place since 2013 that contributed to the growth of the independent game scene in Berlin. Lorenzo also helps run Saftladen, Berlin’s first indie game collective and co-working space. Previously he worked as a producer for the indie game studio Maschinen-Mensch and as programme manager for A MAZE. / Berlin festival.

title: Marijam Didžgalvytė
details: is a Lithuanian-Tatar videogames industry critic and author of 'Everything to Play For: How Videogames Are Changing the World' (Verso Books). Her work has been published by the Guardian, VICE, GamesIndustry.biz, and others. She previously served as Chair of Communications Committee for Game Workers Unite International and co-founded GWU UK. The book is being translated into 7 languages and was selected as one of The Guardian's Best Books of 2024.

title: Farfama Hargaaya
details: is a media artist currently based in Japan, specializing in experimental digital games. His work explores themes of awe, wonder, and playful joy, drawing inspiration from nature, ritual, and everyday observation.

title: Cindy Poremba
details: has maintained an experimental gamemaking and curatorial practice for almost two decades with a particular interest in captured media practices, and emerging technologies. They are an Associate Professor in Digital Futures at OCAD University (Tkaranto), and Co-Director of OCAD’s game:play Lab. Their award-winning game, curation, and -New Arcade- work (independently and as a member of the kokoromi collective), has been featured in both game and digital art exhibitions internationally.

title: Marina Diez
details: is a Spanish award-winning game designer, game director, business expert, filmmaker and Forbes Under 30 lister based in Europe living a semi nomadic life. Marina is also a Game Director for an unannounced game at BTF Games and Principal Game Designer at BTF Games for The Berlin Apartment. Previously, she was the Lead Game Designer for the game Dordogne by Un Je Ne Sais Quoi Studios & Umanimation. Marina is also a consultant on emotional game design for indie and AAA companies and a filmmaker, having showcased her work all around the world.

title: Ferran Bertomeu Castells
details: is a freelance game designer & developer who has been involved in game development associations and events in Barcelona (VGAFIB & GGJ), and has been involved supporting events like the GAEMZ meetup in Tokyo & online. Ferran has been making music-related video games and games for songs for some time, collaborating with musicians and bands, as well as studying and sharing about music games beyond rhythm games in a couple of events including IndieDevDay.es and Gamedev.world

title: Simona Maioriano
details: is a game developer living in Italy. She co-created and curated Antifa Arts and Games, co-founded the local game dev community in Bari and she got a nomination as best talent at Amaze 2019. Simona is currently working on her contemplative narrative game: Sea of Leaves, showcased at Game happens,2019, and contemporary art showcase -Tresette- 2021. Simona also co-created -March Together!- a feminist game showcased at the Overkill Festival, 2024

title: Malath Abbas
details: is a game designer and creative producer based in Scotland. Malath works across games, digital art, and interactive media, often leading experimental and socially engaged projects. Malath is the co-founder of Biome Collective, a creative studio and community exploring the boundaries of play, technology, and storytelling. Malath also runs Arcadia, a festival that celebrates diverse voices in game design and culture.

title: Roquekes
details: is an artist and drone pilot with a background in ceramics, graphic design, and industrial design. The work includes installation, interactive art, public space interventions, and editorial projects, with participation in self-publishing festivals such as Creativa, Autobán, FunFunFun, among others. In 2022, Roquekes also directed the virtual reality section of the Intersección contemporary film and art festival and took part in the MMMAD festival as a member of the Mariola collective. More recently, the artistic practice has been combined with cultural management and video games through JugarJueguitos, a project that organizes workshops, talks, and exhibitions, including the shows JugarJueguitos and Otra forma (2024).

title: Violeta Moldes Rivas
details: is a Pre-doctoral researcher of the MEDIUM group in the Department of Communication at the Universitat Pompeu Fabra. She holds a degree in Design and Creative Technologies from the Universitat Politécnica de València and a master's degree in Digital Culture and Emerging Media from the Universitat Pompeu Fabra. She has worked for several years in the independent sector of the video game industry and belongs to the anti-capitalist artistic collective Resistència Videolúdica, dedicated to the dissemination and exercise of critical thinking around the video game as a medium.

title: Luis Diaz Peralta
details: is a freelance game designer who also makes lots of tiny free games and some commercial ones. Luis has created and managed many game events of all sorts.

title: Pietro Righi Riva
details: Is a game director, producer, and curator specializing in narrative-driven, innovative games for a broad audience. Experienced in leading successful multidisciplinary, diverse, and international teams of various sizes, ensuring excellence despite budget and scheduling constraints. Notable achievements include bringing multiple award-winning, commercially successful games to market. In 2010, Pietro co-founded the indie game studio Santa Ragione. In 2014, he defended his PhD in Interaction Design. In 2016, Pietro started a manifesto for nontraditional game design called Rejecta. In 2018, won the IndieCade Innovation in Experience Design Award, and in 2023, the DStars Award for Best Italian Producer. Since 2024, Pietro has been offering Consultancy Services aimed at independent game creators and small-to-medium sized studios..

title: Luca Carrubba
details: holds a PhD in Fine Arts, is a sociologist of communication and a specialist in interactive technology. Throughout his career he has collaborated with different institutions in Spain and the Americas, such as Centro de Cultura Internacional Tabakalera, Centro de Cultura Digital de México or Idartes Bogotá, among others. As a researcher and academic he has published numerous articles and essays on technology, art, video games and digital culture teaching in different national and international universities. His theoretical production is accompanied by a long history of artistic creation with the project Estereotips.net addressing the computer code as a creative artifact. He is currently curator of the exhibition Homo Ludens: video games to understand the present, by La Caixa Foundation. Before and after all this, Carrubba is co-director of Arsgames, an international organization that works at the crossroads between art, science, technology and citizen participation with video games, a brand under which he currently develops all his projects.

title: Ruixuan Li
details: (Rashel) is an independent curator, game designer, media artist, and writer based between Madison, WI and Shenzhen. She currently leads her studio, Curaxuan, in producing a 'Super Maria' puzzle game Go Groundshel!. Li has curated In Search of the Godmama (Toronto), Games-in-Residence (Shenzhen), YouXi DimSum (Pittsburgh), and Game Site (Shanghai), and served as Executive Editor of Curating the Digital Expanded for OnCurating (Zurich). Her writing has appeared in The Initium Media, The Art Newspaper China, and Artco China, among others. She is currently an editor at the indie game media platform indienova and a committee member of Mirage Sci-fi Magazine.

title: Agustin Crisostomo
details: is an animator, illustrator and designer based in Manila.
